Mask repeated fragments of an input sequence

Source: R/purge_seq.R
purge_seq.Rd

Returns your sequence with substitution of repeated fragments by 'n' .

purge_seq(
  sequence,
  format = "fasta",
  match.length = NULL,
  mismatch = NULL,
  both.strand = TRUE,
  delete = NULL,
  mask.short = NULL
)

Arguments

sequence

Sequence to purge
format

Sequence format. Supported: 'IG' (Intelligenetics), 'WC' (wconsensus), 'raw', 'fasta'. Defaul is 'fasta'.
match.length

Minimal match length. Default is 40.
mismatch

Number of mismatches allowed. Default is 3.
both.strand

Discard duplications on the direct strand only (FALSE) or on the reverse complement as well (TRUE). Default is TRUE.
delete

Delete repeats instead of masking them if TRUE.
mask.short

Mask (replace by N characters) sequences shorter than the specified length.

Value

An string with results retrieved from RSAT

Examples

## Purge sequence with repeats of length 10
res <-
    purge_seq(sequence = ">seq1\nTCGCAATCTACTTACTATTGCTTACTATTGCTTACTATTGCGAGCGCAGA")
#> 
#> Error details:
res
#> $Fault
#> $Fault$faultcode
#> [1] "soap:Server.ExecError"
#> 
#> $Fault$faultstring
#> [1] "Execution error: # sequence length: 50, number of masked symbols: 0 (0.00 percent of the sequences)\ncommand: &RSAT::util::hide_RSAT_path(/space23/rsat/perl-scripts/purge-sequence -format 'fasta' -2str -i '/space23/rsat/public_html/tmp/apache/2020/02/10/purge-sequence_2020-02-10.214140_bnhQv9')"
#> 
#> 

res2 <-
    purge_seq(sequence = "TCGCAATCTACTTACTATTGCTTACTATTGCTTACTATTGCGAGCGCAGA",
        match.length = 10,
        format = "raw")
#> 
#> Error details:
res2
#> $Fault
#> $Fault$faultcode
#> [1] "soap:Server.ExecError"
#> 
#> $Fault$faultstring
#> [1] "Execution error: # sequence length: 50, number of masked symbols: 34 (68.00 percent of the sequences)\ncommand: &RSAT::util::hide_RSAT_path(/space23/rsat/perl-scripts/purge-sequence -format 'raw' -2str -ml '10' -i '/space23/rsat/public_html/tmp/apache/2020/02/10/purge-sequence_2020-02-10.214141_wHIKLJ')"
#> 
#>
